name: MultiTouchSwipe
description: This extension enables you to check for multiple swipes at once.
These swipes work in 4 directions: left, right, up, down.
These swipes do not currently have expressions.
These swipes work in all directions, you can set the angle and tolerance of the swipe.
These swipes have 2 expressions: swipe angle and swipe distance.
The extension also has 3 actions to change how the extension functions:
Start position check: check the start position of the touch instead of the current position.
Set touch amount: set the custom amount of touches registered by the extension. By default you can use 20 fingers and the cursor.
Reset on touch end: Reset the swipe distance and angle values once the touch has ended.

events.comment: Sets the amount of touches registered by the extension (By default you can play with all of your fingers at once + the cursor)
Registers a new touch and clears the previous values.

eventsFunctions.description: Enable or disable start position checking.
eventsFunctions.name: EnableStartCheck
eventsFunctions.sentence: Check for start position of the touch: _PARAM1_

events.comment: Makes the extension check for the start position instead of the current touch position.

parameters.description: Check the start position of the touch (instead of the current position)
parameters.name: StartCheck

eventsFunctions.description: Change the amount of touches the extension can register.
eventsFunctions.name: CustomTouchAmount
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the amount of supported touches to _PARAM1_

events.comment: In case someone wants to change this value.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the touch angle and distance values once the touch ends.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetOnTouchEnd
eventsFunctions.sentence: Reset the touch values on touch end: _PARAM1_

events.comment: Allows the user to reset the touch distance and angle values once the touch has ended.

parameters.description: Reset the distance and angle of the touches back to 0 once they have ended
parameters.name: Reset

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if the user recently swiped up.
eventsFunctions.name: SwipedUp

events.comment: Checks for every touch that has been registered (check the top functions).

parameters.description: How much the touch needs to travel (in pixels)
parameters.name: Distance

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if the user recently swiped down.
eventsFunctions.name: SwipedDown

events.comment: Checks for every touch that has been registered (check the top functions).

parameters.description: How much the touch needs to travel (in pixels)
parameters.name: Distance

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if the user swiped left.
eventsFunctions.name: SwipedLeft

events.comment: Checks for every touch that has been registered (check the top functions).

parameters.description: How much the touch needs to travel (in pixels)
parameters.name: Distance

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if the user swiped right.
eventsFunctions.name: SwipedRight

events.comment: Checks for every touch that has been registered (check the top functions).

parameters.description: How much the touch needs to travel (in pixels)
parameters.name: Distance

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if the user swiped in the designated area.
eventsFunctions.name: SwipedAngle

events.comment: Checks for every touch that has been registered (check the top functions). This looks more complicated but all it does is check the distance between the start and current touch positions and also compares the angle between these positions. It also saves these values to variables, so that they can be used later.

parameters.description: How much the touch needs to travel (in pixels)
parameters.name: Distance

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the swipe angle (not for 4 directional swipes).
eventsFunctions.name: SwipeAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the swipe distance (not for 4 directional swipes).
eventsFunctions.name: SwipeDistance

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the ID of the last touch.
eventsFunctions.name: LastTouchID

events.comment: This can be used outside of the extension's main premise. I added this because LastTouchId() didn't work for me.
